p: A study measured the naturally-occurring prevalence of chikungunya virus in wild mosquito populations ( Table 2). Díaz-González et al. [ 72] reported 18 Ae. aegypti positive pools in Mexico, out of 557 tested. A study reported on the prevalence of both chikungunya and Zika viruses among Ae. aegypti in Ecuador ( Table 2) [ 30]. Three studies tested both chikungunya and dengue viruses in wild mosquito populations ( Table 2). Chikungunya, but not dengue, was detected in Ae. aegypti in Mexico by Cigarroa-Toledo et al. [ 71], although both chikungunya and dengue viruses were isolated in Mexico in Ae. aegypti by Dzul-Manzanilla et al. [ 59], and in Martinique by Farraudière et al. [ 61].
